taskGroup.name: Create a DaoJones Hello World Application
taskGroup.intro: In this tutorial, you will create a Java application accessing a Notes database using DaoJones and the local Notes client installation. In the example, you will create a TODO item in your mail database. To practise the query language, you will search for the task in a second example.

task.name: Prepare local Notes client
task.intro: To access the database, you have to prepare your local Notes client.

task.name: Set up DaoJones project
task.intro: In this step, you will create the Java project and configure its Build Path to include the DaoJones runtime.
task.onCompletion: Now you have a Java project containing the DaoJones runtime.

task.name: Configure DaoJones connections
task.intro: To access the database, you need to configure the connections within a configuration file. Then you have to read the configuration file within your application.

task.name: Create Task bean
task.intro: In this exercise, you will create the DaoJones bean to access Task documents.
task.onCompletion: After completion, you are able to access the database to read and write Task documents.

task.name: Create Task
task.intro: In this step, you will write some lines of code to create a simple task item.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations, you have now created a document in the database.

task.name: Search for Task
task.intro: The next exercise handles the DaoJones query language.
